edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train

Interface FeatureExtractor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFeatureExtractor, CountFeatureExtractor, DTUFeatureExtractor, LexicalReorderingFeatureExtractor, MosesPharoahFeatureExtractor, PhiFeatureExtractor, ReorderingWithSyntaticPhrasalCategoryFeatureExtractor, ShallowSyntacticContextFeatureExtractor, SoftMosesPharoahFeatureExtractor, SparseVectorFeatureExtractor, SyntacticPhraseReorderingFeatureExtractor

    public interface FeatureExtractor
    Interface for extracting sentence-level and phrase-level features from training data.
    Author:
    Michel Galley

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void featurizePhrase(AlignmentTemplateInstance alTemp, AlignmentGrid alGrid)
      Extract features from phrase pair f-e and sentence word alignment.
      void featurizeSentence(SymmetricalWordAlignment sent, String info, AlignmentGrid alGrid)
      Extract features from sentence word alignment.
      boolean needAlGrid()
      Returns true if the feature extractor needs to have access to access to the alignment grid, which may contain various information such as phrase positions.
      void report()
      Called to report the status of each FeatureExtrator, but only if a specific output is provided with the FeatureExtractor.
      Object score(AlignmentTemplate alTemp)
      Assign here a value for each alignment template and each feature.
      Object scoreNames()
      Names of features returned by score(AlignmentTemplate).

    • Method Detail

      • needAlGrid

        boolean needAlGrid()
        Returns true if the feature extractor needs to have access to access to the alignment grid, which may contain various information such as phrase positions.
        See Also:
        AlignmentGrid

      • featurizeSentence

        void featurizeSentence(SymmetricalWordAlignment sent,
                     String info,
                     AlignmentGrid alGrid)
        Extract features from sentence word alignment. Note that it is implicitely assumed that each class implementing FeatureExtractor is mainining its own data structures in order to assign scores with score(AlignmentTemplate). Hence, extract is returning void. As opposed to featurizePhrase(AlignmentTemplateInstance,AlignmentGrid), which is called once for each instance of alignment template, this function is called once for each sentence pair.

      • featurizePhrase

        void featurizePhrase(AlignmentTemplateInstance alTemp,
                   AlignmentGrid alGrid)
        Extract features from phrase pair f-e and sentence word alignment. Note that it is implicitely assumed that each class implementing FeatureExtractor is mainining its own data structures in order to assign scores with score(AlignmentTemplate). Hence, extract is returning void.
        Parameters:
        alTemp - A particular occurrence of an alignment template.
        alGrid - A two dimensional array, in which each cell (i,j) contains the set of AlignmentTemplateInstance objects that have one of their four corners lying at (i,j) in the alignment grid. Not that if needAlGrid() returns false, alTemps is always null.

      • score

        Object score(AlignmentTemplate alTemp)
        Assign here a value for each alignment template and each feature. Return value must currently be an instance of double[].
        Parameters:
        alTemp - Alignment template to score.
        Returns:
        Feature values, which must either be represented as double[].

      • scoreNames

        Object scoreNames()
        Names of features returned by score(AlignmentTemplate).

      • report

        void report()
        Called to report the status of each FeatureExtrator, but only if a specific output is provided with the FeatureExtractor. Note: do not output to STDOUT since that will mess up the combined behavior of the PhraseExtract.
